overview_of_class: This course focuses on interconnections between new ideas in literature, culture and politics in the early 20th century. Texts include great Modernist novels Petersburg (1913) by Andrei Bely, Master and Margarita (1940) by Mikhail Bulgakov and Evgeny Zamyatin's We (1921); poetry by Aleksandr Blok, Vladimir Mayakovsky, and Osip Mandelstam. These major works are discussed in the broad Russian and European cultural and historical context.
name: Interpreting Culture
title: WCAS COMP_LIT 202-0-1 Interpreting Culture

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: This course focuses on interconnections between new ideas in literature, culture and politics in the early 20th century. Texts include great Modernist novels Petersburg (1913) by Andrei Bely, Master and Margarita (1940) by Mikhail Bulgakov and Evgeny Zamyatin's We (1921); poetry by Aleksandr Blok, Vladimir Mayakovsky, and Osip Mandelstam. These major works are discussed in the broad Russian and European cultural and historical context.

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value:
Petersburg (1913) by Andrei Bely,
Master and Margarita (1940) by Mikhail Bulgakov
We by Zamyatin's (1921);
poetry by Aleksandr Blok, Vladimir Mayakovsky, and Osip Mandelstam.

subject: COMP_LIT
